panels.content:
This is a training dashboard, and a good place to start customizing a dashboard to your needs.

Everything in the dashboards can be edited (though once you have something the way you want it, you can turn editing off) If you click on the title "Your Basic Dashboard" above you can edit it. If you click on the cog/gear icon next to something, you can edit it. And the X icon is used throughout to delete a graph, text area, or table.
panels.title: Introduction

panels.content: The page is 12 spans wide, you can add in as many graphs, text areas, etc as you like. By clicking on the cog icon above you can set the width of this area, and select one of 12 graph types that you would like rendered here, or remove this area entirely.
panels.title: First Step

panels.content: You can add more rows by clicking the cog in the upper right (the one with the “Configure dashboard” tooltip).
panels.title: How to add rows

panels.content:
The data is stored in "types" you can search across as many types as you want, but if you are after something specific (such as email, stock, or product) then it is easiest to filter by that type. 

Note too that this text doesn't fill up the entire row, so there is an easy "Add" button to the right where you can add another text area, or chart. When you are ready try deleting this and the previous rows help text, cleaning up the dashboard for your report!
panels.title: Where is the data ?

panels.content: If your report / dashboard cares about time, you might want to add a 'timepicker' panel here. Click the cog icon over to the left to do so. You can also remove these information text panels there
panels.title: Have a timestamp somewhere?

panels.content:
#### Filtering
See the small *Filters* text to the left below? Click it to expand the filters row. Right now there are none. click on one of the icons in the document types list to filter down to only that document type

### The most generic dashboard ever
It's the best I can do without knowing much about the data you are after! The two *terms* panels to the left of this *text* panel show a breakdown of the document types available. 

The *table* panel below has attempted to list your fields to the left, select a few to view them in the table. To add more panels, of different types, click the cog on the row label to the far left

You can click to zoom in on a graph, search for only some documents within a type, and muliple search, charts, tables, save and share!

At the upper right hand side are buttons to save, load, or share a dashboard. You can search ElasticSearch for dashboard created by others, and save your own dashboards there. The best way to create a new dashboard is to start with one that is close to what you would like, start editing it, and then save it with a new name when you are done. Have fun reporting!

Optionally in the search you can use an "advanced" query syntax, which is outlined here:
http://lucene.apache.org/core/2_9_4/queryparsersyntax.html
